div.pre: 2022 Peradace, near Tiriolo, 10 km. WNW (803) of Catanzaro, Bruttium, 1926 Burial: late 3rd cent. B.C. (K) Contents: 103+ AR, 6+ AE. Pot hoard Brettii: 4 AE Carthage: 103 quarter-shekels (102 female hd./horse; 1 young male hd./horse r.) 2 AE (Persephone/horse hd.) Disposition: Reggio, 103 AR Ferri, NSc 1926, p. 329 Pfeiler, JNG 1964, pp. 34-6 The quarter-shekel with male hd. is de- scribed by Ferri as being a negro hd. The coin is, however, form the issue ascribed to Hannibal in Spain (Essays Mattingly, pl. 3, 7n); it weighs 1.74 gm., and is more worn than the majority of quarter-shekels in this hd.
